localize.title: Buzzing on Reddit
localize.description: See what's buzzing on Reddit in your native language

nodes.excerpt: With these design patterns by Juro and Stefania Passera, you can turn boring legal text into a transparent, engaging document that people can actually read.
nodes.title: Privacy Policy Template by Juro - Get a privacy policy people can actually read
nodes.author: Christoph Janz

nodes.excerpt: Never forget a section for your readme again! Select sections to add to your readme, edit the contents, and drag to rearrange. See a live-updating rendered preview of your markdown, then download your README.md file!
nodes.title: readme.so - Easily create the perfect readme for your project
nodes.author: Katherine Peterson

nodes.excerpt: Lip Gloss a Go library for designing terminal user interfaces. It takes an expressive, declarative approach to terminal rendering. Users familiar with CSS will feel right at home with Lip Gloss.
nodes.title: Lip Gloss - Design terminal user interfaces
nodes.author: Christian Rocha

nodes.excerpt: Developers have been using the Grouparoo UI to set up automated data movement from their databases to cloud-based tools like Mailchimp. Grouparoo now supports declarative code to set up this pipeline so you manage data sync just like you would any other app.
nodes.title: Grouparoo 2.0 - Integrate with marketing tools using low-code configuration
nodes.author: Hiten Shah

nodes.excerpt: Spaceman is an application for macOS that allows you to view your Spaces in the menu bar. Spaceman allows you to see which space you are currently on relative to the other spaces you have. Naming these spaces is also an option.
nodes.title: Spaceman - A macOS app to view virtual desktops in the menu bar
nodes.author: Jay

nodes.excerpt: I am a forgetful person. Many times after I open my MacBook and scan some news, I totally forget what I initially try to accomplish. I want to build a simple tool to display my current goal on the menu bar
nodes.title: One Goal - Makes your goal more visible by showing it on the menu bar
nodes.author: timqian

nodes.excerpt: Collect your avatar from different parts. The code of this program is very easy, any developer will be able to understand the code. SVG is used to draw an avatar. Demo version of the project: https://avatar-maker-vue.netlify.app/
nodes.title: Avatar Maker - Create your own avatar
nodes.author: David Voskanyan

nodes.excerpt: The Awesome lists on GitHub are great, but it's hard to know which projects are actively maintained and sift through them all easily. I built this tool to help me visualize and query all of the cool resources people put together.
nodes.title: Awesome Viewer - Visualize all of Github's awesome lists
nodes.author: Aryaman Sharda

nodes.excerpt: Gladys Assistant is an open-source home automation software. It's easy to install on a Raspberry Pi, a NAS, or any machine running Linux.
nodes.title: Gladys Assistant v4 - A privacy-first, open-source home assistant
nodes.author: Pierre-Gilles

nodes.excerpt: A simple and elegant desktop application for managing your Laravel applications. - Execute Artisan commands easily in a nice interface. - Tinker with your project in a magical code editor.
nodes.title: Laravel Kit - Desktop Laravel admin panel app with no configuration needs
nodes.author: Tareque Md Hanif

nodes.excerpt: Serverless Invoices is a free tool for invoice generating and management - no signup needed. Truly serverless, your data is safe with you in your browser. Export/import your invoices. It's open source, easy to modify, easy to deploy.
nodes.title: Serverless Invoices - Free, serverless invoice generator - open sourced
nodes.author: Marek

nodes.excerpt: Formst is a JavaScript library for structuring and validating forms in React. It is based on MobX-State-Tree which makes it simple and performant and it is built on the principles of "UI as an afterthought".
nodes.title: Formst - Model-driven form library for React
nodes.author: Gaurav Guha

nodes.excerpt: Terminhack lets you pretend to be a hacker running real penetration testing tools. You can run it directly from the website or from your terminal!
nodes.title: Terminhack - Impress your friends by pretending to be a real hacker ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»

nodes.excerpt: A small app for making quick flowcharts from text â¿».
nodes.title: flowchart.fun - An open-source tool for generating flowcharts from text
nodes.author: Mehmet Akyol

nodes.excerpt: Athens is an open-source and local-first alternative to Roam Research. Athens is the most powerful and transparent knowledge graph.
nodes.title: Athens Research - Open-source, local-first Roam Research
nodes.author: Jeff Tang

nodes.excerpt: Global.health is a collaborative effort by technologists and researchers from leading international institutions to build a trusted, detailed, and accurate resource of real-time infectious disease data.
nodes.title: Global.health - Access data about 5M+ anonymized COVID-19 cases
nodes.author: Chris Messina

nodes.excerpt: The easiest way to build simple, powerful websites with nothing but Notion. Turn your Notion pages into fast, functional websites in minutes with free subdomain, custom google fonts, custom javascript code, pretty URLs, search engine optimization, and more.
nodes.title: Notion Dog  - Turn your Notion pages into websites in minutes

nodes.excerpt: The Developerâ€™s Homepage ___ Hackertab, a handy extension to help developers stay up-to-date with the latest tech happenings. Itâ€™s fully customizable, for frontend, backend, full-stack, mobile, data scientistsâ€¦ bref, for all developers.
nodes.title: Hackertab.dev - Hottest programming trends right in your tab ğŸ”¥
nodes.author: Mehdi Sakout

nodes.excerpt: YoMo is an open-source Streaming Serverless Framework for building low-latency edge computing applications. Built atop QUIC transport protocol and functional reactive programming interface, it makes real-time data processing reliable, secure, and easy.
nodes.title: YoMo - A serverless framework for latency sensitive applications
nodes.author: YonaCao

nodes.excerpt: SigNoz is an open-source alternative to DataDog. We help developers find issues in the software they run on cloud and solve them quickly. Run SigNoz in your infrastructure and get your application monitoring setup at 10x lower cost
nodes.title: SigNoz - Open source alternative to Datadog
nodes.author: Michael Seibel

nodes.excerpt: SST (Serverless Stack) is a framework that makes it easy to build serverless apps. It features: -- - A Live Lambda Development environment - Zero-config support for ES and TypeScript - Higher-level constructs designed for serverless
nodes.title: SST - Work on your serverless apps live
nodes.author: Michael Seibel

nodes.excerpt: Infracost is an open source cloud cost estimator in pull requests. When you change your infrastructure code (Terraform), we post a comment in the pull request, telling you the impact to your cloud bill, e.g. â€œthis will increase your bill by 25% next monthâ€.
nodes.title: Infracost - Open source cloud cost estimator in pull requests
nodes.author: Michael Seibel

nodes.excerpt: Our serverless Kubernetes platform is designed for the needs of fast moving development teams who want to focus on delivering applications, not operations.
nodes.title: CTO.ai 2.0 - A smarter workflow for Cloud Native apps
nodes.author: Hiten Shah

nodes.excerpt: Remotion allows you to make real MP4 videos written in React. Use web technologies like CSS, SVG, WebGL to make interesting motion graphics. Use programming to dynamically make different variants of videos and automate it using server-side rendering.
nodes.title: Remotion - Create videos programmatically in React
nodes.author: Jonny Burger
